Johnny starts laughing hysterically, shaking his chained hands like a zoo animal trying to get loose. Russ steps in front of a red-hot Bucky--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bucky) I think you should go outside. EXT. THE FIRE ESCAPE - LATER Bucky sits out on the fire escape watching cars drive by. Russ leans out the window and hands Bucky the statement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His statement. Signed. Bucky reads it and slips it into his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should sit on this for a little bit. Until I can talk to a legal officer. Bucky shakes his head no, climbs back inside the window. INT. THE HOTEL ROOM - DAY Bucky handcuffs Johnny's hands behind his back as the big man cries...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bucky) It's the shithouse until you retire, you know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I owe her this one. He squeezes Johnny's handcuffs tighter. INT. HOLLYWOOD STATION - BOOKING - NIGHT Reporters follow Bucky and Johnny inside, piqued by the sight of a plainclothes officer escorting a cuffed uniform inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No comment...No comment... (whispering in Johnny's ear) Tell your Daddy I know everything. Including his extortion deal. Tell him I'm goin' to the papers tomorrow. He approaches the desk sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this? A flashbulb goes off in their faces. Johnny sobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Officer Dwight Bleichert and this is Officer John Vogel. He hands over Johnny's signed statement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Book him. Another flashbulb. EXT. CENTRAL STATION - LATER Bucky jogs up the steps inside. INT. THE LOCKER ROOM - LATER He dresses in his blue uniform, preparing to go back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officer Bleichert, go to the watch commander's office immediately. Bucky brushes imaginary dust off his shirt and grabs his hat. INT. LIEUTENANT JASTROW'S OFFICE - SOON AFTER Bucky walks in, saluting like an idealistic rookie. Jastrow stands, ignoring the salute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're on two weeks vacation leave as of now. When you return to duty, report to Chief Green. He'll reassign you to another division.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fritz Vogel just blew his brains out. That's why. All Bucky can think to do is salute again, rock firm. He walks outside and crosses into INT. THE MUSTER ROOM - CONTINUOUS Crammed with blues awaiting roll call. They all stare at Bucky; he meets the eyes that seek his, making them look down. Defiant. As he passes he can hear the hisses: "Traitor". "Bolshevik". He continues towards the door, almost out when suddenly he hears applause. Bucky turns to see,Russ Millard, Harry Sears and Thad Green clapping good-bye... INT. THE CASTING OFFICE - DAY Clapstick: "Elizabeth Short Screen Test #4" She sits on an ugly brown sofa, sides in her hands. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right, Miss Short? She looks up, seeing the camera as if for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just...talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put the sides down. Just...talk to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you like to talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...Anything...Do you have a boyfriend? FADE OUT EXT. THE SANTA MONICA PIER - NIGHT Kay and Bucky sit on a bench, looking out at the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could take sick days. Maybe a trip to Santa Barbara, or even a drive to San Francisco...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't owe him a thing, Bucky. I know you won't believe me. But you've more than repaid him already. He looks at her and she knows it's useless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First thing. She takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a fool, Dwight. EXT. THE SAN DIEGO FREEWAY - LATE MORNING as Bucky crosses the border into Mexico.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I closed out my glory days the only way I knew how--I chased the gone man. EXT. TIJUANA STREETS - VARIOUS SHOTS - DAY Bucky hands out pennies and nickels to locals, flashing both his badge and snapshots of Lee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : BUCKY AND AN ENTOURAGE OF TRAILING LOCALS as Bucky tries to shake them, pulling out his pockets to show them he has no more coins. CUT TO: BUCKY QUESTIONING TIJUANA COPS graduating from small change to one dollar bills. Same of them seem to have stories to tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got headshakes, bullshit broadsides and a strange series of tales that rang true. One had "el blanco explosivo" beating the shit out of three jack rollers, then buying off the cops with double-saws peeled from a large roll. Another had Lee donating 200 scoots to a leper ministry priest and then driving to Ensenada. EXT - THE COASTAL ROAD - LATE AFTERNOON as Bucky drives South, passing a sign which says "ENSENADA 60 MI." He passes a cluster of families walking on the side of the road. They carry suitcases and head North. EXT. THE COAST ROAD - NEAR ENSENADA Bucky approaches Ensenada. The trickle of families headed north has now becoming a roadside migration march. Every fifth of sixth marcher carries a torch or lantern. EXT. THE CITY LIMITS OF ENSENADA - NIGHT Bucky cruises slowly into town and the most blatant shakedown he's ever seen: Rurales in brownshirts walk from peasant to peasant in the northbound migration line, taking money and attaching tags to their shoulders with staple guns; plainclothes cops sell bags of beef jerky and dried fruit, putting coins into dispensers attached to their belts. Two Rurales pull a man out of line and beat him senseless with the butts of their sawed-off shotguns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I decided it would be wise to check in with the law before going out to question the Ensenada citizenry. EXT. THE ENSENADA POLICE STATION - NIGHT Bucky stands outside a converted church with the word POLICIA painted in black over religious scenes. INT. THE POLICE STATION - NIGHT Velvet wall hangings depicting Jesus decorate the entrance hall. Blackshirts lounge on converted pews, a huge carved cross on the front desk betrays its altar origins. Bucky slides the Rurale at the desk his badge and a dollar. The man saunters off down the hall. INT. THE POLICE CHIEF'S OFFICE - MINUTES LATER as Bucky is escorted in. The man sitting behind the desk looks up. In flawless English:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officer Bleichert. Come in, please. I'm Captain Vasquez. How can I help you? Bucky exchanges his badge for a photo of Lee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man's LAPD. He's been missing in Mexico since January. He was last seen headed here. Vasquez studies the photo. Bucky senses a twitch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm afraid not. I'll ask my men, however. Staying the night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you here alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have two partners waiting for me in Tijuana. Vasquez nods, hard to know if he believes Bucky any more than Bucky believes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't mind I'll check back in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. A FLEABAG MOTEL ROOM - LATER Bucky squeezes a bit of brown water onto a handkerchief and wipes his brow off. He kicks his travel bag underneath the bed and heads out. EXT. THE HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS as Bucky pulls two hairs from his head and spit-glues them to the door jamb. EXT. THE ENSENADA STREETS - NIGHT Garish neon, military personnel. Brownshirts packing serious weapons keeping the mostly white street crowd in order. HIS POV: An adobe streetfront with a neon sign: "CLUB BOXEO". Bucky goes inside. INT. THE CLUB BOXEO - CONTINUOUS Bucky finds a brightly lit room filled with sailors and half- dressed Mexican strippers. He stands on his tip-toes trying to see over the crowd to find somebody with the air of proprietor. Cn a far wall: boxing publicity stills. He wanders over. CLOSE ON THE WALL OF STILLS: A row of light-heavies: Gus Lesnevich, Billy Conn, and Bucky. Three stills over, next to Joe Louis, is Lee's photo. They all look so young...So good... An old voice in English breaks his reverie:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleichert? Jesus. First Blanchard, then you. Who's next? Willie Pep? Bucky wheels and finds himself face to face with an old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blanchard? You've seen him? When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple months ago. Heavy rains in February. Musta talked fights for ten hours straight. You know Blanchard thinks the feathers are the best division? me, it's the middies for sure. La Motta, Graziano--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he still in town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't think so. I own this place. He ain't been back. You lookin' for a rematch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking to get him out of a shitload of trouble. The old pug looks him up and down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. I'll tell ya the little I know. Heard he caused a ruckus over at the Club Satan, had to bribe his way out big with Captain Vasquez. Talk to Ernie the cook. Tell him I said to be kosher with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't been in there. INT. CLUB SATAN - LATER Bucky walks into the biggest sewer you have ever seen. The bar is a urinal trough where marines and sailors masturbate while going down on nude women squatting on the bartop. Blow jobs are being dispensed underneath tables facing the bandstand. Up on the stage a man in a Satan costume is fucking a woman on a mattress. Next to him, a donkey with red velvet horns pinned to his head eats hay out of a bowl while drunken servicemen shout "Donkey! Donkey!" Bucky is accosted by a disgusting old woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wan' the bar, handsome? Breakfast of champions, one dollar. Round the world, two dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ernie. I need to see Ernie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vamanos! And grabs him by the arm... INT. THE KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS ERNIE, a half-Mexican half-Chinese man, stands next to a huge vat of stew. Bucky flashes Lee's photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard this man gave you some trouble a while back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who wants to know? Bucky flashes his badge, giving him a glimpse of his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You his friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my best friend. The chef tucks his hands into his aprons, fidgeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend drink fourteen shots of my best Mescal, a house record. That I like. He make toasts to dead women. That I don't mind. But he try to fuck with my donkey show, and that I don't take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four of my guys he take, the fifth he don't. Rurales take him home to sleep it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it? Ernie casually pulls a switchblade out of his apron and scratches the back of his neck with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finito. EXT. THE CLUB SATAN - LATER Bucky walks outside and begins weaving his way back through the crowds. Out of the corner of his eye he catches a couple Rurales who seem to have taken an interest in him. He dodges down an alley and cuts down another street, breaking into a slow jog. EXT. ANOTHER STREET - SECONDS LATER Bucky walks backwards, checking the crowd. He's lost them. INT. THE FLEABAG MOTEL - LATER Bucky stands in front of his door. He runs his finger up and down the door jamb. The hairs are gone. With one swift kick he breaks down the door. INT. THE MOTEL ROOM - SECONDS LATER A white man stands with his hands raised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, Bleichert. I'm a friend-- Bucky gestures with his gun for the man to hit the wall. He frisks him, pulling out a wallet and tossing on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milton Dolphine, citizen of San Diego and a licensed private dick. I got seventy bucks in there but that money's jackshit compared to what Blanchard was holding. You go partners with me and it's easy street-- Bucky kicks the man's legs out and pushes his to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell me all of it and you watch what you say about my partner, or it's a B&E roust and the Ensenada jail. Dolphine pulls himself up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean Vasquez? How do you think I knew to follow you? He's got a vested interest in you not finding out about Blanchard. Bucky eyes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he know I'm staying here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Bucky steps back from Dolphine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. Let's hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About a month ago this Mexican woman shows up at my office in Dago. Chubby, ten tons a makeup, but dressed to the nines. Offers me five hundred to find Blanchard. Just like you I track him here where he's playing the rich gringo-- A FLASHBACK - LEE TEARING UP AN ENSENADA BAR DOLPHINE I even see him beat up two spics who insult this Senorita--Rurales stand by and do nothing. So I know he's paying protection dough. A lot of it. Then  I hear he paid off two plainclothes Rurale to snuff a coupla guys in TJ-- A FLASHBACK - BOBBY DE WITT AND FELIX CASCO BLOWN AWAY...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I leave a message in Dago for the woman tellin' her what I know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's her name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delores Garcia. But it was obviously a phony. Casco ran with some rich bimbos and I'm betting she's one of his. Revenge on Blanchard for offin' Felix. Bucky tightens his grip on the slats of a wooden chair. This is hitting him hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I come back to Ensenada on my own, thinking about all that cash he was flashing. Bucky's jaw clenches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna hear this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blanchard's dead. Bullet in the cabeza. (beat) Rumor is they never found any money. Bucky's head begins to reel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe the Rurales. Maybe that woman or friends of hers. Who knows? I figured Blanchard was rogue, figured someone like you'd come lookin' for him. Maybe have a line on where the cash was. You knew Blanchard, maybe we can-- Bucky backhands Dolphine hard, knocking him off the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look I didn't know it was personal! Don't hit me again-- Bucky has his gun out, leveled at Dolphine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prove it to me. Prove it! EXT. THE BACKROADS OF ENSENADA - NIGHT Dolphine drives his car while Bucky trains his gun on him. They come over a ridge and find themselves on a big bluff overlooking the ocean. A HUGE WOODEN BURNING CROSS marks the spot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The locals keep the damn thing lit up. They got a lotta missing relatives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a shovel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gardening tools--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good enough. EXT. THE BLUFF - LATER Bucky scavenges a spare piece of picket fence, wraps it in a rag and lights a torch off of the cross. Dolphine kicks at a filthy American flag in the sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Supposed to be near el bannero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A SMALL SHOVEL PUSHING INTO THE GROUND as Dolphine digs at gun point. After a few strokes the crunch of the shovel hitting bone. Bucky terrified to look but has to know-- --a white jumper--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sailor's uniform. It's a sailor... Bucky breathes out hard. Unbearable. Dolphine digs on, pushing the corpse out of the way and digging further into he sand. Bucky can't stand the suspense. He tucks his gun into his waistband and grabs the shovel. After a few more strokes the thump of something solid. And suddenly it's there--sunburned pink skin, blond hair and stitch scars on the eyebrows. Lee Blanchard. Lee Blanchard. Lee Blanchard. And Bucky's in Dolphine's truck while Dolphine's screaming for him to wait and Bucky slams the truck in reverse, knocking the burning cross to the ground and grinding out out of the sand onto the road, heading north and leaving Dolphine and Lee alone at the grave...Heading north like a refugee... EXT. KAY'S HOUSE - DAWN Bucky's car rolls up slowly as he kills the engine, trying not to make any noise. The sun comes up, illuminating Bucky's filthy face as he watches the picture-perfect house, wishing time would stand still. Or better yet, wishing it would go back... Finally he gets out of the car and begins a long walk into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A LAPD CHAPLAIN READING SOLEMNLY FROM A BIBLE But as the camera PULLS BACK we see Bucky in his dress blues standing next to Kay in a wedding dress. EXT. THE BACKYARD OF KAY'S HOUSE Russ Millard and Harry Sears stand by as the only two guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lee and Kay had lived in sin; not because their shack job was against department regs, but because the ghosts of their past had forced them to choose between love and passion, the veneer of a "fairy tale" only a band-aid for a fractured life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : LEE AND KAY DANCING TOGETHER as Harry and Russ drink from a punch bowl...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our true vows were made in private; bury the past, bury our ghosts, and as Kay said, "bury that fucking girl"... ANOTHER LAPD TRANSFER FORM: "Officer Dwight Bleichert...Reassigned to: Scientific investigation Detail" INT. THE LAPD SCIENCE LAB - DAY Bucky with plastic gloves on typing blood with an eye dropper and a test tube. Meticulous and boring. News radio plays in the background... A Detective pokes his head in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleichert? You got those prints for me? Bucky pulls a file out of a stack and gives it to him. The nonchalance of a man whose job has become routine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. We gotta hot one I think. Bucky smiles politely and returns to his desk. The radio:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...results in the 1948 Republican primary are final...John Dougdale trouncing D.A. Ellis Loew 64% to 36%...In county primaries... This gets a smile from Bucky as he returns to his test tubes and beakers. INT. AN APARTMENT - CRIME SCENE - DAY Detectives comb through a murder scene as Bucky collects latent fingerprints off doorknobs. No one pays him any attention. He's been relegated to the worst kind of purgatory. INT. THE KITCHEN - MORNING Bucky and Kay drink coffee and read the morning paper. She absently strokes his free hand. Bucky intently reads the front page. The headline reads: "CITY COUNCIL INVESTIGATES '20s BOOM BARONS FOR SHODDY HOME CONSTRUCTION". Underneath, a picture of Sprague and Mack Sennett posing in front of the HOLLYWOODLAND sign. He's startled by Kay tapping her finger on the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That reminds me of something, Dwight. Bucky tries to hide his panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Floorboard's loose near the closet. Think you could fix it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (relieved) Sure, babe. The phone rings. Bucky answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello...Hey Vic... Bucky writes something on a piece of paper. Hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta go. Work-up on a probable gunshot suicide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds lovely. Where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hancock Park. EXT. A COLONIAL MANSION - JUNE STREET - MORNING Bucky rings the bell. He's dressed plainclothes and carries a technician's canvas bag. An attractive woman in her early fifties opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Officer Bleichert. LAPD. My I express my condolences, Mrs.--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane Chambers. Condolences accepted. You're the lab man? He nods yes. She lets him in and he follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the study in back of the dining room. You'll see the police rope. If you'll excuse me, I'll be in my garden. He notices for the first time she's dressed for gardening. INT. THE STUDY - MORNING Bucky steps over the police rope and into the study. A large desk chair lies overturned an the ground next to A TAPE OUTLINE OF A BODY. Three feet away lies A SHOTGUN. Behind the chair the brown spattering of blood and brains decorates the white wall and crown mouldings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A SERIES OF SHOTS as Bucky measures the splatter marks on the walls, scrapes tissue from the muzzle of the gun, dusts it for latent prints, etc. At the end he wraps the gun in a plastic bag. INT. THE HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS as Bucky steps over the police rope and walks back towards the main foyer. He stops short. ON THE OPPOSING WALL hangs a disturbing PAINTING: the portrait of a clown, a young boy done up in court jester's garb. His body is gnarled and hunched. He wears a stuporous ear-to-ear smile that looks like one continuous deep scar. It is eerily reminiscent of Elizabeth Short's death wound. Spooked, Bucky pulls his eyes away and settles them on nearby family photos--two young women linked arm in arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other survivors. Pretty aren't they? She arrives next to him, dusty with soil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like their mother. How old are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-one and twenty-three. Are you finished in the study?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Tell whoever cleans it up to use pure ammonia... (looking at the two girls) Mrs. Chambers--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane, do you know Madeleine and Martha Sprague? The next block over?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snorts) Those girls and that family. How do you know them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did a little work for them once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consider it lucky if it was a brief encounter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you mean? The hallway phone rings. Jane moves to answer it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back to condolences. Thank you for being so nice, Mr.--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bucky. Good-bye, Jane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye. INT. THE CRIME LAB - LATER Bucky writes up a report. VIC pokes his head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finish working up the suicide, Bucky?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Pretty routine. Whattya know about the husband?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eldridge Chambers? Widow said he was depressed, failing health. The terrible burden of all that money'll get you every time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonder how he made it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No mystery there. Real estate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh really? INT. THE GARAGE - EVENING The garage door is open to the evening air. Bucky's heavy bag and speed bag hang on hooks. Bucky leans against a stool, a large box open on the work bench. INSIDE THE BOX Bucky brushes aside a clutter of junk and pulls out A PHOTO ALBUM. He opens it and begins flipping through: articles and photos concerning Elizabeth Short. MOSTLY PHOTOS. It's like a man in a mid-life crisis fantasizing about his high school sweetheart. OFF ONE OF THE PHOTOS WE DISSOLVE TO: ANOTHER ELIZABETH SHORT CASTING SESSION "Elizabeth Short...Screen Test #5" She rambles on, almost oblivious of the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I had a fiance, Captain Matt Durand. He was in a tank battalion. A Commander. He had...the fiercest blue eyes. Like the deep water you see from a fishing boat... She's lost in thought...we're not sure whether this is a scene, her real life, or just a sad lie... THE NOISE OF A CAR APPROACHING BACK TO SCENE Bucky drops the album back in the box as Kay's car pulls into the driveway. He covers it back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (getting out) What're you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm...looking for the hammer. She points over his shoulder to the hammer hanging in plain view. INT. THE BEDROOM - LATER Bucky kneels on the ground near the closet, toolbox next to him. He pulls on the floorboard, it flexes and squeaks. He uses the hammer to pull the board completely off. He squeezes wood glue around the edges and is about to replace the board when something under the floor catches his eye. He reaches into the hole, pulling out STACKS OF HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS BOUND WITH RUBBER BANDS. He spies another scrap of paper in the hole... INT. THE KITCHEN - SAME Kay pours two scotches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dwight? She carries the scotches into the bedroom and finds Dwight sitting on the floor, staring at thousands of dollars in cash. He holds a paper money band inscribed: "$100...Boulevard- Citizens Bank..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. I...always wondered where he kept it. THE BOULEVARD-CITIZENS BANK HEIST - A FLASHBACK A SHOTGUN BLAST shatters the back window of the armored truck. In the front seat, LEE BLANCHARD ducks down as the driver hits the gas... BACK ON THE SCENE as Bucky leans back against the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you ever going to tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'd given all his money to Ben Siegel. (beat) He wanted to give me a home. A FLASHBACK - LEE'S CAR Lee and Bucky, their first day as partners...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...said I'd get a shot at Joe Louis if I'd take two dives for him. I said no... BACK ON THE SCENE as Bucky looks straight up into the ceiling light...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you ever going to tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knew what Bobby was doing to me...How he'd used a razor on me...pimped me to his friends... INT. DEWITT'S APARTMENT - A FLASHBACK as Lee plants the incriminating bank bags in DeWitt's closet... BACK ON THE SCENE Bucky staring back into the hole in the floor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Bobby know nothing about the bank job. He and Lee, they never even met. After Lee and his driver got away, Lee figured framing Bobby'd give me a way out... EXT. DEWITT'S TRIAL - FLASHBACK Lee leads Kay out of the courtroom. BACK ON THE SCENE as Kay leans down next to Bucky, gently putting her hand on his shoulder...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then last year...the fourth man--the driver--he heard Bobby was getting paroled. He threatened to tell DeWitt that Lee framed him. He wanted money we didn't have. Ten thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever. Were you ever...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise me this: Forgive him for DeWitt. Forgive him for the bank. It doesn't matter anymore. Not to us.
direction.name: direction
